meanings.definition: Of, like, or suitable for a child in behavior or attitude.
meanings.sent1: The boy's childish giggles filled the room.
meanings.sent2: She scolded him for his childish behavior.
meanings.sent3: The childish way he pouted when he didn't get his way was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her childish excitement at the sight of the ice cream truck was contagious.
meanings.sent5: The childish drawing of a stick figure made everyone smile.

meanings.definition: Immature or lacking in adult sophistication.
meanings.sent1: His childish tantrum over losing the game was unnecessary.
meanings.sent2: She found his childish jokes endearing.
meanings.sent3: It was childish of him to believe in fairy tales at his age.
meanings.sent4: The decision to ignore the problem was a childish move.
meanings.sent5: The childish way he avoided responsibility was frustrating to everyone.
